abstract: Earnings for the conglomerate rose 14 percent in the second quarter, though revenue declined.
snippet: Earnings for the conglomerate rose 14 percent in the second quarter, though revenue declined.
lead_paragraph: General Electric reported on Friday that its second-quarter earnings rose 14 percent, but revenue fell below analysts’ expectations and, with the stock market in a broad decline, G.E.’s shares fell 4.59 percent.

headline.main: G.E. Revenue Falls Short of Forecasts, Despite Strength in Finance and Health
headline.print_headline: G.E. Revenue Falls Short of Forecasts, Despite Strength in Finance and Health
